page.title: 05 Cliftonville Hotels
page.content: Many of the hotels and guest houses of the Edgar Road and Surrey Road are more than fifty years old. They were built at a time when very few English families took their holidays abroad. Now, despite active advertising the hotels are distinctly under used. The short family season of July and August has been extended by concession rates to OAP groups. Some conventioneers may use the Winter Gardens out of season. Solutions to this problem of under use are varied. Some hotels are large enough to provide indoor entertainment others have become almost permanent homes for old people. London Boroughs have bought some for their own use. Others are now schools of English for foreign students.
